Name.label: Autosomal recessive limb-girdle muscular dystrophy type 2Y
Qualitative or quantitative defects of Torsin-1A-interacting protein 1

TextSection.Contents: A form of limb-girdle muscular dystrophy, presenting in the first or second decades of life, characterized by slowly progressive proximal and distal muscle weakness and atrophy. Additional manifestations include contractures of the proximal and distal interphalangeal hand joints, rigid spine, restricted pulmonary function, and mild cardiomyopathy.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))

Synonym.label: Autosomal recessive muscular dystrophy due to LAP1B deficiency
Autosomal recessive muscular dystrophy due to Torsin-1A-interacting protein 1 deficiency
Muscular dystrophy with progressive weakness, distal contractures and rigid spine
